enhanced_by.reason: The hex method relies on the nextRandomBytes method to generate random bytes, which are then converted to a hexadecimal string.
The hex(int) method is a simpler version of hex(int, boolean) and can be used to set up similar test cases.
The hex method must be invoked after nextRandomBytes to ensure the random bytes are available for conversion.
The hex(int) method can be invoked before hex(int, boolean) to set up the initial state for testing.
